kaiViz moduleÔÉÅ

kaiViz.DrawCut(Rin=2.5, ax=None)ÔÉÅ

Draw a cut using matplotlib.patches.Wedge.

Parameters:

  • Rin (float) ‚Äì The inner radius of the cut. Default is 2.5.

  • ax (matplotlib.axes.Axes, optional) ‚Äì The axes on which to draw the cut. If not provided, the current axes will be used.

Returns:

The created Wedge object representing the cut.

Return type:

matplotlib.patches.Wedge

class kaiViz.MidpointNormalize(vmin=None, vmax=None, midpoint=None, clip=False)ÔÉÅ

Bases: Normalize

Custom normalization class that maps values to the range [0, 1] with a specified midpoint.

Parameters:

  • vmin (float, optional) ‚Äì The minimum value of the input range. If not provided, the minimum value of the input data will be used.

  • vmax ‚Äì (float, optional): The maximum value of the input range. If not provided, the maximum value of the input data will be used.

  • midpoint (float, optional) ‚Äì The midpoint value that will be mapped to 0.5 in the output range. If not provided, the average of vmin and vmax will be used.

  • clip (bool, default False) ‚Äì If True, values outside the range [vmin, vmax] will be clipped to vmin or vmax.

Returns:

The normalized value(s) within the range [0, 1].

Return type:

normalized_value (numpy.ma.masked_array)

Example usage:

` norm = MidpointNormalize(vmin=0, vmax=10, midpoint=5) normalized_value = norm(7) print(normalized_value)  # Output: 0.7 `

kaiViz.SetAx(xyBds=[-1, 1, -1, 1], ax=None, Adj='box')ÔÉÅ

Set axis plot bounds and aspect ratio.

Ensure that the plot has an equal aspect ratio and that the axis limits are set to the specified values.

Parameters:

  • xyBds ‚Äì list of 4 float, optional, default [-1, 1, -1, 1] Axis limits for x and y as (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax).

  • ax ‚Äì matplotlib.Axes, optional, default None Axes object to modify.

  • Adj ‚Äì str, optional, default ‚Äòbox Specify what aspect of the plot to adjust to achieve equal aspect ratio.

Returns:

None

kaiViz.ShaveX(fName)ÔÉÅ

ShaveX function crops an image file by removing one pixel from the right side.

Parameters:

fName (str) ‚Äì The file name of the image to be cropped.

Returns:

fName file is cropped by one pixel on the right side.

fName (str) ‚Äì The file name of the image.

Returns:

fName file is cropped by one pixel on the top.

kaiViz.addEarth2D(Re=1, angle=-90, ax=None)ÔÉÅ

Adds a 2D representation of Earth to the given matplotlib axes.

Parameters:

  • Re (float) ‚Äì Radius of the Earth. Default is 1.

  • angle (float) ‚Äì Angle at which the Earth is rotated. Default is -90.

  • ax (matplotlib.axes.Axes) ‚Äì The axes to which the Earth will be added. If None, the current axes will be used.

Returns:

A list containing the two Wedge objects representing the Earth.

Return type:

list

  • scId (str) ‚Äì The identifier for the subplot legend.

  • data (dict) ‚Äì A dictionary containing the data to be plotted.

Returns:

Image file saved to disk.

kaiViz.genCB(AxCB, vN, cbT='Title', cM='viridis', doVert=False, cbSz='medium', Ntk=None)ÔÉÅ

Generate a colorbar using matplotlib.

Parameters:

  • AxCB (Axes object) ‚Äì The axes object where the colorbar will be drawn.

  • vN (Normalize object) ‚Äì The normalization object used to map data values to colors.

  • cbT (str, optional) ‚Äì The title of the colorbar. Default is ‚ÄúTitle‚Äù.

  • cM (str, optional) ‚Äì The name of the colormap to use. Default is ‚Äúviridis‚Äù.

  • doVert (bool, optional) ‚Äì Whether to display the colorbar vertically. Default is False.

  • cbSz (str, optional) ‚Äì The size of the colorbar labels and title. Default is ‚Äúmedium‚Äù.

  • Ntk (int, optional) ‚Äì The number of ticks to display on the colorbar. Default is None.

Returns:

The generated colorbar object.

Return type:

cb (Colorbar object)

kaiViz.genNorm(vMin, vMax=None, doLog=False, doSymLog=False, midP=None, linP=1.0)ÔÉÅ

Generate a matplotlib color normalization object based on the given parameters.

Parameters:

  • vMin (float) ‚Äì the minimum value of the data range

  • vMax (float) ‚Äì optional, the maximum value of the data range (default: None)

  • doLog (bool, optional) ‚Äì whether to use logarithmic normalization (default: False)

  • doSymLog (bool, optional) ‚Äì whether to use symmetric logarithmic normalization (default: False)

  • midP (float, optional) ‚Äì the midpoint value for midpoint normalization (default: None)

  • linP (float, optional) ‚Äì the linear threshold for symmetric logarithmic normalization (default: 1.0)

Returns:

the color normalization object

Return type:

vN (matplotlib.colors.Normalize)

Note

If vMax is not provided, the absolute value of vMin is used as both vMin and vMax. If midP is not provided, midpoint normalization is not used. If doLog is True, logarithmic normalization is used. If doSymLog is True, symmetric logarithmic normalization is used. If none of the above conditions are met, linear normalization is used.

ax ‚Äì The matplotlib Axes object.

The aspect ratio of the Axes object.

kaiViz.helioCompPlot_new(plot_file_path, sc_id, sc_data)ÔÉÅ

Create comparison plots for heliospheric results.

Create comparison plots for heliospheric results and save the plots to a file. The plots will compare simulation results to measured spacecraft data. The compared variables are radial velocity, radial magnetic field, number density, and temperature.

Parameters:

  • plotname (str) ‚Äì Path to file to hold plot image.

  • scId (str) ‚Äì ID string for spacecraft.

  • data (spacepy.datamodel.SpaceData) ‚Äì The current spacecraft and model data

Return type:

None

kaiViz.helioItemPlot_new(Ax, sc_id, data, key, plotNum, numPlots, show_zero=False)ÔÉÅ

Plot a single variable for the comparison plot.

Plot a single variable for the comparison plot.

Parameters:

  • Ax (matplotlib.axes._subplots.AxesSubplot) ‚Äì Matplotlib axis for plot.

  • data (spacepy.datamodel.SpaceData) ‚Äì Object containing the measured spacecraft data.

  • key (str) ‚Äì Name of variable to plot.

  • plotNum (int) ‚Äì Position of plot in sequence of plots.

  • numPlots (int) ‚Äì Number of plots in sequence.

  • show_zero (bool, default False) ‚Äì Set to True to show a black dashed line at the 0 level for the variable.

Returns:

None

kaiViz.helioTrajPlot(plot_file_path, sc_id, sc_data)ÔÉÅ

Create a set of trajectory plots for a heliospheric spacecraft.

Create a set of trajectory plots for a heliospheric spacecraft. These plots are created in the original spacecraft frame.

Parameters:

  • plot_name (str) ‚Äì Path to plot file.

  • scId (str) ‚Äì Name of spacecraft.

  • data (spacepy.datamodel.SpaceData) ‚Äì Object containing spacecraft data.

Return type:

None

kaiViz.reWrap(V)ÔÉÅ

Re-wraps a 2D array by adding an extra column at the end, where the values in the new column are the same as the values in the first column.

kaiViz.savePic(fOut, dpiQ=300, doTrim=True, bLenX=20, bLenY=None, doClose=False, doEps=False)ÔÉÅ

Save a matplotlib figure to a file.

Parameters:

  • fOut (str) ‚Äì The output file path.

  • dpiQ (int) ‚Äì The resolution of the saved figure in dots per inch (default: 300).

  • doTrim (bool) ‚Äì Whether to trim the saved figure (default: True).

  • bLenX (int) ‚Äì The length of the x-axis trim boundary (default: 20).

  • bLenY (int) ‚Äì The length of the y-axis trim boundary (default: None).

  • doClose (bool) ‚Äì Whether to close all figures after saving (default: False).

  • doEps (bool) ‚Äì Whether to save the figure in EPS format (default: False).

Returns:

Image File saved to disk.

kaiViz.trajPlot(plotname, scId, data, toRe)ÔÉÅ

Plot the trajectory of a spacecraft.

Parameters:

  • lotname (str) ‚Äì The name of the plot.

  • scId (str) ‚Äì The spacecraft ID.

  • data (dict) ‚Äì A dictionary containing the spacecraft‚Äôs ephemeris data.

  • toRe (float) ‚Äì The conversion factor from meters to Re (Earth radii).

Returns:

Image file saved to disk.

kaiViz.trimFig(fName, bLenX=20, bLenY=None, doEven=True)ÔÉÅ

Trims the figure image file by removing the borders and resizing it to have even dimensions.

Parameters:

  • fName (str) ‚Äì The file name of the figure image.

  • bLenX (int) ‚Äì The length of the border to be added on the X-axis. Default is 20.

  • bLenY (int) ‚Äì The length of the border to be added on the Y-axis. If not provided, it will be set to bLenX.

  • doEven (bool) ‚Äì Flag indicating whether to resize the image to have even dimensions. Default is True.

Returns:

Image file saved to disk.
